metadata.title: CVE-2020-10773 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A stack information leak flaw was found in s390/s390x in the Linux kernelâ€™smemory manager functionality, where it incorrectly writes to the/proc/sys/vm/cmm_timeout file. This flaw allows a local user to see thekernel data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10773` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-170-generic - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-4.4.0-170-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-4.4.0-170-lowlatency - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-4.4.0-170-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-4.4.0-170-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-4.4.0-170-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-4.4.0-170-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-170-generic - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-170-lowlatency - 4.4.0-170.199
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-72-generic - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-72-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-72-lowlatency - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-72-generic - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-72-lowlatency - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1063-kvm - 4.4.0-1063.70
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1099-aws - 4.4.0-1099.110
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1056-aws - 4.15.0-1056.58~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1064-azure - 4.15.0-1064.69
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1050-gcp - 4.15.0-1050.53
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1030-oracle - 4.15.0-1030.33~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-170.199').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1063.70').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1099.110').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.58~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1064.69').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1050.53').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.33~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.135').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1130.138').
